description:
Error Message:

========================================
nova/scheduler/host_filter.py:225:69: E202 whitespace before ']'
                    ['>=', '$compute.disk.available', required_disk]
                                                                    ^
    Avoid extraneous whitespace in the following situations:

    - Immediately inside parentheses, brackets or braces.

    - Immediately before a comma, semicolon, or colon.

    Okay: spam(ham[1], {eggs: 2})
    E201: spam( ham[1], {eggs: 2})
    E201: spam(ham[ 1], {eggs: 2})
    E201: spam(ham[1], { eggs: 2})
    E202: spam(ham[1], {eggs: 2} )
    E202: spam(ham[1 ], {eggs: 2})
    E202: spam(ham[1], {eggs: 2 })

    E203: if x == 4: print x, y; x, y = y , x
    E203: if x == 4: print x, y ; x, y = y, x
    E203: if x == 4 : print x, y; x, y = y, x
========================================


Steps to reproduce the issue:

# bzr branch lp:nova /opt/nova
# cd /opt/nova
# python tools/install_venv.py
# source .nova-venv/bin/activate
# ./run_tests.sh -p
title: nova/scheduler/host_filter.py fails pep8

comments.content:
Error Message:

========================================
nova/scheduler/host_filter.py:225:69: E202 whitespace before ']'
                    ['>=', '$compute.disk.available', required_disk]
                                                                    ^
    Avoid extraneous whitespace in the following situations:

    - Immediately inside parentheses, brackets or braces.

    - Immediately before a comma, semicolon, or colon.

    Okay: spam(ham[1], {eggs: 2})
    E201: spam( ham[1], {eggs: 2})
    E201: spam(ham[ 1], {eggs: 2})
    E201: spam(ham[1], { eggs: 2})
    E202: spam(ham[1], {eggs: 2} )
    E202: spam(ham[1 ], {eggs: 2})
    E202: spam(ham[1], {eggs: 2 })

    E203: if x == 4: print x, y; x, y = y , x
    E203: if x == 4: print x, y ; x, y = y, x
    E203: if x == 4 : print x, y; x, y = y, x
========================================


Steps to reproduce the issue:

# bzr branch lp:nova /opt/nova
# cd /opt/nova
# python tools/install_venv.py
# source .nova-venv/bin/activate
# ./run_tests.sh -p
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jshepher

comments.content:
Proposed Solution:

# diff nova/scheduler/host_filter.py nova/scheduler/host_filter.py.orig 
225c225,226
<                     ['>=', '$compute.disk.available', required_disk]]
---
>                     ['>=', '$compute.disk.available', required_disk]
>                 ]
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jshepher

comments.content:
Hmm, that doesn't seem correct. Which version of pep8 are you using?

The merge to trunk didn't complain nor did my local checks.

I'm using 0.6.1
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~sandy-walsh

comments.content:
Sandy

You are correct.. my venv build had pulled pip-0.5.0 instead of 0.6.1. I pulled the new package and verified that this is no longer an issue.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jshepher
